# What is Quarto?

## An open-source, scientific & technical publishing system

<br>

![Quarto Schematic, Artwork by Allison Horst.](assets/img/horst_quarto_schematic.png)

## Weave together narrative & code

Produce elegantly formatted output as documents, web pages, blog posts, books and more 

<br>
<br>

Using a variety of authoring tools!

![Quarto Authoring Tools.](assets/img/quarto_authoring_tools.png)


## Just like Rmarkdown ...

... but much more powerful!

<br>

- **Consistent implementation** of attractive & handy features across outputs: tabsets, code-folding, syntax highlighting, etc.
- Features & defaults that enable good practices for producing **accessible documents**
- Natively **multi-lingual**, supporting multiple languages (R, Python, Julia, Observable)

## Illustration of Quarto 

<br>

![Quarto Schematic, Artwork by Allison Horst.](assets/img/horst_qmd_render_schema.png)

## What happens under the hood?{.smaller}

`knitr`: R package for dynamic report generation

`jupyter`: popular notebook authoring tool in Python community

`pandoc` is a command line markup format converter 

![Illusration by Christoph Scheuch.](assets/img/quarto_process_breakdown.png)

```` markdown
Here goes some code:

```{{r}}

```

#| output: false
2 * 2
```
````

## Include code & plot with R{.smaller}

```{r}
#| echo: true
#| fig-align: center
library(ggplot2)
library(palmerpenguins)

penguins <- palmerpenguins::penguins

ggplot(penguins,
       aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = bill_depth_mm, color = species, shape = species)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm") +
  labs(x = "Bill length (mm)", y = "Bill Width (mm)",
       title = "Bill Length vs. Bill Width", color = "Species", shape = "Species") 
```

## Replicate the same with Python{.smaller}

```{python}
#| echo: true
#| fig-align: center
from plotnine import *
from palmerpenguins import load_penguins

penguins = load_penguins()

(ggplot(penguins, 
        aes(x = "bill_length_mm", y = "bill_depth_mm", color = "species", shape = "species"))
  + geom_point()
  + geom_smooth(method = "lm")
  + labs(x = "Bill Length (mm)", y = "Bill Width (mm)", 
         title = "Bill Length vs. Bill Width", color = "Species", shape = "Species"))
```

## Creating dashboards

Official Quarto tutorial: [quarto.org/docs/dashboards](https://quarto.org/docs/dashboards/)

Simple example dashboard: [colorado.posit.co/rsc/nz-quakes/quakes.html](https://colorado.posit.co/rsc/nz-quakes/quakes.html)

<br>
Key features:

- Supports static (`ggplot2`, `seaborn`, `matplotlib`, etc.) & dynamic plots (`plotly`, `leaflet`, `htmlwidgets`, etc.)
- Can be deployed as static html content or with dynamic `shiny` server backend
